intro: Gilia achilleifolia subsp. multicaulis, commonly known as the multicaulis gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a sprawling or ascending growth habit. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are branched and can reach several feet in length. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
